posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
Took a break for a few years (3 or 4 ish).  Went to GOG a few days ago and still had my account, so re-downloaded Diamond Edition to replay one of my favorite modules: Ronin Kensai of Kyoto.  Now, I want to take a character from Ronin through SOTU/HOTU and into whatever old modules I did to get them to level 40.  The hitch is that I want to do a character that is a Monk (for monk gear, free cleave & KD/IKD), Ranger (for free dual wield, FE & ranger search skills in SOU beginning) & Pally (for Holy Avenger in SOU).

Human, of course, but want to avoid experience penalties.

I'm asking the ECB to give me tips - I'd post a build to tear down, but it's been so long, I'm out of practice.

1) PvM 
2) Level 40 (playable 1-40)
3) Human
4) Monk/Ranger/Paladin
5) Dual wield (strength OR dex)
6) Range preference: either.  This dude's a meleer who'll use ranged weapons to thin out the opposition.
7) Weapon preference - He will need Weapon Focus: Exotic to start (to use the Katana in Ronin), and by level 40, will probably dual wield kamas, but any thing with Holy Avenger cast/crafted onto it will work, as well.
8) Maximum item enhancement - the later mods that get you into the late 30s/level 40 seem to be +10
9) Spellcasting - primarily buffing.
10) Custom factors - nope

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
For that build, I would go Str and Wis - and pick up Zen Archery.

The Wisdom has lots of synergy in that build - all three classes use it.  Pally and Ranger for spells, and Monk for AC (and with Zen Archery, for Ranged).

You'll want to have some positive Cha (Cha 13+), if possible, for Divine Might/Shield.

The build will be tricky to build without an XP penalty imo - here is an example : http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 87609.html

In that build, I would shy away from going Dex and Weapon Finese for Wis/Zen Archery.  Your Dex bonus to AC is not tied down with Uncanny Dodge, so it may end up being useless for defense, dependingly.  Wis AC for Monks never gets compromised (unless wearing Armor, Shield).  Also, with more Wis, one will have more spells (though Ranger/Paladin does not have the best of spell lists imo).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hey Theophilus
Great to hear from you. Great concept. 
Had a look at the module on the NWN Vault, it looks awesome.

Without uncanny dodge in the build, I would favor strength based as you will lose all that dex AC when flat footed, may as well do more damage, be able to wield non-finessable weapons well and carry more. With monk speed and max discipline hopefully one can run from mobs, set up a few traps re-engage etc with stealth

Holy Sword requires Paladin 15+. Ranger and Dual Wield requires Ranger 9+
To avoid exp penalties I was thinking Paladin 21 / Ranger 10 / Monk 9.

This might give you some ideas. No exp penalties. If there are things you want or don't want, don't hesitate to comment and I can edit them in.

posts.content: SoU is intended to start at level 1.  If you play another module before SoU, you will be too strong for SoU, and it will be too easy.
